intro: Evolvulus muehlenbergii, commonly known as blue morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces small, showy blue or violet flowers that bloom in the morning. The leaves are heart-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and can climb or trail along the ground. This species is adapted to moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in disturbed areas and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
